meanings.definition: To fix firmly in a surrounding mass
meanings.sent1: She carefully imbedded the gemstone into the clay.
meanings.sent2: The roots of the tree were imbedded deep in the soil.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully imbedded chocolate chips into the cookie dough.
meanings.sent4: His words were imbedded in her mind like a catchy tune.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her laughter was imbedded in his heart forever.

meanings.definition: To incorporate or include as an essential part
meanings.sent1: The artist imbedded hidden symbols in her painting.
meanings.sent2: The new technology was imbedded seamlessly into the existing system.
meanings.sent3: The detective imbedded himself in the crowd to catch the thief.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was imbedded in every action she took.
meanings.sent5: The values of honesty and integrity were imbedded in their upbringing.
